newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-PALACE SAY LOMBARDO DEAL LOOKS DOUBTFUL.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-PALACE SAY LOMBARDO DEAL LOOKS DOUBTFUL.

text.p: Crystal Palace manager Steve Coppell said on Wednesday that talks to sign Italian winger Attilio Lombardo from Juventus had hit an obstacle.
"My gut feeling at the moment is that the deal looks like its going to break down," Coppell told the English premier league side's clubcall telephone information service.
Newly-promoted Palace had agreed the transfer with Italian champions Juventus last week but said the player had not yet agreed personal terms and had not flown to London as expected.
Coppell said that he could not put a timeframe on the 2.1 million pound ($3.5 million) transfer for the 31-year-old international.
"We are still in discussions although we do seem to be some way off," he said. "The total package is a lot of money and possibly too much for us at this present stage.
"But it never ceases to surprise me how deals can spring back into life," Coppell said.
Lombardo, who played for Sampdoria before moving to Turin, was almost signed by Sheffield Wednesday last year but that deal also foundered on the player's wage demands.
